API¶

In this section, the API of schnel package is provided.

SCHNEL¶

algorithm.py¶

algorithm.cluster(source, feature_ids=None, num_of_scales=0, num_of_neighbours=30, transformation_method=None, cofactor=5, p_comps=None, cell_by_feature=True, csv_header=False)¶

This method is responsible for running the whole SCHNEL algorithm pipeline. Input data is parsed and transferred to numpy array. Afterwards, numpy array is processed with the help of C++ code wrapped with the help of pybind11. The output is a hsne binary file containing the generated HSNE hierarchy. HSNE hierarchy file is read by the HSNE parser which creates clustering with the help of Leiden algorithm. The output of this function is the list of matrices with columns as scales and rows as cluster classifications.

Parameters

  • source – file path, ndarray, h5ad object or list of file paths

  • feature_ids – array of components on which the data should be clustered

  • num_of_scales – number of scales used for creating an HSNE hierarchy structure

  • num_of_neighbours – number of neighbours used in clustering

  • transformation_method – type of transformation used (log, arch or None)

  • cofactor – if arcsinh was specified you can pass the cofactor for thistransformation

  • p_comps – Number of principal componenets after PCA

  • cell_by_feature – true if input data is cell by feature, false if feature by cell

Returns

list of matrices equal to the size of the points/cells (rows)by the number of hierarchy scales (columns)

clustering¶

HSNE_parser.py¶

clustering.HSNE_parser.build_subscale(handle, i, numscales, logger)¶

Build subscale of the hierarchy.

Parameters

  • handle – _io.BufferedReader (object result from calling native Python open() )

  • i – int, current scale

  • numscales – total number of scales

  • logger – Logger object

Returns

Subscale

clustering.HSNE_parser.read_HSNE_binary(filename, verbose=True)¶

Read HSNE binary from file and construct HSNE object with top- and sub-scales.

Parameters

  • filename – str, file to read

  • verbose – bool, controls verbosity of parser

Returns

HSNE object

HSNE.py¶

class clustering.HSNE.HSNE(num_scales)¶
cluster_scale(scalenumber, prop_method='cluster')¶

Clusters data using Leiden algorithm on a given scale.

Parameters

  • scalenumber – scale that clustering should be applied to

  • prop_method – label or cluster. Cluster returns cluster labels and label labels data scale mapping.

Returns

Clustering results. Either label or cluster.

get_datascale_mappings(scalenumber)¶

Generates data scale mappings between most representative landmarks and data vectors at given scale.

Parameters

scalenumber – scale of desired mapping

Returns

dictionary of mappings, keys are enumerated and values are respective representative landmarks

get_map_by_cluster(scalenumber, clustering)¶

Maps given cluster at given scale.

Parameters

  • scalenumber – scale to create map at

  • clustering – membership results of clustering

Returns

map between data and cluster assignment

get_topscale()¶

Getter for top scale of the hierarchy.

Returns

first scale

run_louvain(scalenumber)¶

Runs Leiden algorithm on a given scale.

Parameters

scalenumber – scale to cluster on

Returns

membership of data

Data_Prep¶

csv_to_numpy.py¶

Data_Prep.csv_to_numpy.csv_to_numpy(file_path, csv_header=False)¶

Translates csv files to numpy array.

Parameters

  • csv_header – make true if there are column names in the data

  • file_path – path to file

Returns

numpy array

dataprep.py¶

Data_Prep.dataprep.parse_to_numpy(source, transformation=None, cofactor=5, features_after_pca=50, csv_header=False)¶

Main method that accepts files of type: .csv, .fcs, .h5ad as wel as objects of type: np.ndarray and h5ad object. It also transforms(log, arcsinh) data or performs pca analysis on it.

Parameters

  • csv_header – make true if there are column names in the data

  • source – file/object to become an ndarray

  • transformation – one of two can be applied ‘log’ - logistic, ‘arcsinh’ - arcsine, Default is set to None

  • cofactor – only use when applying arcsinh transformation, Default is set to 5

  • features_after_pca – amount of features to stay after performing pca on given data, default is 50

Returns

an np.ndarray ready to be clustered

fcs_to_numpy.py¶

Data_Prep.fcs_to_numpy.fcs_to_numpy(file_path)¶

translate fcs extension file data into a numpy array

Parameters

file_path – path to the file

Returns

numpy.ndarray

h5ad_to_numpy.py¶

Data_Prep.h5ad_to_numpy.h5ad_to_numpy(source, pca=50, previous_pca=False)¶

takes in h5ad source, performs pca if specified and returns numpy array of results.

Parameters

  • source – file path the h5ad file

  • pca – desired PC’s. Default 50.

  • previous_pca – True to use objects previously computed PCA. Default false.

Returns

numpy.ndarray

Data_Prep.load_data.load_mnist()¶

Sample MNIST data used to show basic functionality of SCHNEL package.

Returns

images of MNIST data set (10k), labels of MNIST data set (10k)

pca.py¶

Data_Prep.pca.pca(data, comps)¶

Returns pca of data with desired components.

Parameters

  • data – numpy array to perform PCA on

  • comps – number of PC’s

Returns

array with PCA transformation

read_dir.py¶

Data_Prep.read_dir.read_directory(directory_path, ext='')¶

Reads files from a directory.

Parameters

  • directory_path – directory from which files will be read.

  • ext – extension of files that should be read from this directory. (simple regex is also recognized).

Returns

List with files ready to pass to main cluster function.
